job_description:
Reddit is a community of communities where people can dive into anything through experiences built around their interests, hobbies, and passions. Our mission is to bring community, belonging, and empowerment to everyone in the world. Reddit users submit, vote, and comment on content, stories, and discussions about the topics they care about the most. From pets to parenting, there's a community for everybody on Reddit and with over 50 million daily active uniques, it is home to the most open and authentic conversations on the internet. For more information, visit redditinc.com.
Reddit's Emerging Talent program is ready for our next cohort of interns, and we need Software Engineering Interns to join our crew! Are you a beginner Software Engineer with a dream of both coding and browsing subreddits at work? Well, you're in the right place! Reddit is in search of Software Engineering Interns to join our internship program (and we guarantee you'll get to do some of both!).

Responsibilities:
Work on projects that impact the business. You'll gain exposure to how a real engineering team works, from sprint planning to shipping code.
Be mentored by experienced engineers from all backgrounds. From bootcamps to universities, small to medium and large companies, you'll work with engineers of many different experiences and levels. You'll have a formal mentor on your team guiding you throughout the summer as well!
Contribute to the betterment of Reddit, whether that be through making it easier to create content on Reddit, serving up relevant content to users, fighting evil on the site, improving our mobile apps, or a number of other projects we have in the works.
Come to work at our San Francisco or New York office, complete with catered lunch, free snacks, and easy access to downtown SF or NYC.
Continue making Reddit history as a part of our next intern class. Be a part of a new community, earn some Reddit swag and get to know the city during sponsored outings over the course of the summer.

Required Qualifications:

Actively working towards a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or a related field
Graduating between December 2025 and June 2026, with less than 2 years of relevant professional work experience
Experience working with a database, social networks, or open source projects
Strong knowledge of CS fundamentals (able to program your way out of a paper bag)
You're over the age of 18 and authorized to work in the United States

Preferred Qualifications:

A desire to work at either our Reddit HQ in San Francisco or New York City during summer 2025
Experience with interactive design
Experience working at a small start-up or mid-sized company


Pay Transparency: The base pay range for this position is: $50 - $60/hour.

Application Volume Expectation:
Thank you for your interest in Reddit! Our team is small & mighty, but will be working to get back to you as soon as possible. We thank you for your patience! - Reddit Emerging Talent Team

job_title_: S25 Intern - IT Software Engineer 163600B E1
job_description:
Note: Applicants need to be legally authorized to work in the United States

About Nintendo of America: From the launch of the Nintendo Entertainment System™ more than 30 years ago, Nintendo's mission has been to create smiles through unique entertainment experiences. Here at Nintendo of America Inc., we deliver on this mission by partnering closely with Nintendo Co., Ltd., to bring Nintendo's iconic and cherished franchises including Mario™, Donkey Kong™, The Legend of Zelda™, Metroid™, Animal Crossing™, Pikmin™ and Splatoon™ across the Americas through our video games, hardware systems, and collaborations with partners on a range of other entertainment initiatives like feature films and theme parks.

Based in Redmond, Wash., Nintendo of America serves as headquarters for Nintendo's operations in the Americas. We are an equal opportunity employer offering a welcoming and inclusive environment in service to one another, our products, and the diverse consumers and communities we call home. For more information about Nintendo, please visit the company's website at https://www.nintendo.com/.

GET SERIOUS ABOUT FUN

As a Nintendo of America Intern, you will actively contribute to meaningful projects, and gain valuable hands-on work experience with a leading company in the entertainment industry. During the program from June through August, your work experience will be enhanced with mentoring, networking opportunities and exposure to industry leaders from across the company! Whether you are in a technical or non-technical role, you will be a part of a team committed to putting smiles on faces of millions around the world.

INTERN - IT Software Engineer

Application Deadline: December 1, 2024

DESCRIPTION OF DUTIES:
Work with Nintendo's IT team to develop, design and implement internal/external web-based application features
Work with the team in a DevOps environment while gaining exposure to end-to-end software project
Provide strong collaboration and communication skills to interface with other IT team members and presentation of work to client stakeholders
Design technical solution while supporting the operational requirements and strategic initiatives

This position is onsite in Redmond, WA, and not open to remote status at this time. Housing and travel support will be provided for non-local hires.

This internship includes a base pay range of $30 per hour, paid sick and safe time, and perks such as a local transit pass and access to the onsite fitness center. Given the limited duration of the role, interns are not eligible for full-time employee benefits such as healthcare or 401(k).
#LI-DNI
job_requirements:
SUMMARY OF REQUIREMENTS:
3.0+ GPA
Currently enrolled in a bachelor's or master's degree program with a graduation conferral date between May 2025 and June 2026
Pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related field
Knowledge of at least one modern programming language (e.g., Python, Typescript)
Exposure to and familiarity with React, React Native
Exposure to and familiarity with JavaScript, HTML, and/or CSS
Knowledge of basic data structures and algorithms
Familiarity with AWS (or similar cloud computing technologies), databases (RDS + DocumentDB), source control tools (Github) and
collaboration tools (Confluence, Jira)
Familiarity of different software development life cycle paradigms a plus
Experience with software development skills and understanding of modern web technologies
Able to articulate technical challenges and solutions effectively
Legally authorized to work in the United States
Able to work 40 hours a week onsite throughout the course of the 10-week summer internship between June - September

job_description:
Job ID: 23266 Downstream Process Development Intern (8-month Co-op/Internship)


AbCellera is breaking the barriers of conventional drug development to propel antibody-based medicines from target to clinic. We are a team of scientists, engineers, creatives, and business professionals who believe that advancing science enhances lives. We have developed technologies to unlock high-value drug targets, including antibody-drug conjugates and T-cell engagers for cancer, and complex transmembrane proteins for indications such as metabolic and endocrine conditions, pain, and autoimmunity.

We are looking for a motivated and talented individual currently pursuing a Bachelor's of Science degree in a relevant field to join our Downstream Process Development team as a co-op or intern for an 8 month term, starting in May 2025. This role would be contributing to the optimization of our purification process for monoclonal antibodies (mAbs) by primarily focusing on the clearance of problematic impurities and studying their behavior and removal with different purification techniques to aid in selection of optimal process conditions.
While in this on-site position, based in beautiful Vancouver, you will receive guidance and support from experienced team members within the Downstream Process Development team. The internship is designed to offer exposure to real-world projects and the opportunity to contribute to the advancement of antibody-based medicines from target to clinic within Canada.

How you might spend your days
• Gaining hands-on experience in molecular biology, protein expression, purification, and characterization techniques
• Developing skills in chromatographic (AKTA) and analytical methods (UPLC, ELISA) used in biopharmaceutical downstream processing
• Gaining insights into the challenges and strategies associated with impurity clearance in mAb production
• Enhancing your critical thinking, problem-solving, and data analysis skills
• Developing your scientific communication, teamwork, and presentation skills

What we offer
AbCellera's hiring range for this role is CAD $3,300 - $3,700 per month, commensurate with your education and job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. In addition to base pay, we offer a number of ways to support AbCellerites in maximizing their work-life synergy. You will have a vacation allowance as well as additional days off as part of our company-wide office closures (a real value to all!), and sick leave time while on your internship. Scientific and technical mentorship is a priority. And you'll find we prioritize teams and social groups to build community and connections across AbCellera.

About AbCellera
AbCellera is a global company that discovers and develops antibody-based medicines that help people live longer, happier, and more productive lives. We are focused on bringing innovative medicines to patients, both by advancing our internal pipeline of programs and partnering with companies that have novel science or innovative technology.
And it all starts with our team. We've built a place where people feel they are part of something bigger than themselves. A place that exists to push the limits of science and technology, and aims to bring better therapies to patients.
We look for people with drive and energy. Idealists. People we love and people we trust. This may be unconventional, but it is the key to our success.

ve an understanding of or interest in downstream purification principles, including chromatography, normal flow filtration, tangential flow filtration, and centrifugation

You have acquired foundational laboratory skills such as pipetting, solution preparation, pH titration, centrifugation

You have experience in data analysis and statistical tools/software

job_description:
Job Overview

Completion of road inspections that will provide an inventory of existing infrastructure located on Forest Service Roads (FSR's). Data entry of inventory data into government road management systems. Exposure to engineering contracts when assistance is required by the contract manager. Possible integration of other district programs to provide overview of district functions.

Accountabilities

Use of a GPS enabled tablet to run traverses of established Forest Service Roads (FSR's), and FSR structures (bridges and major culverts), for the input of predetermined road attributes.
Prepare road summaries from the information gathered from the GPS enabled tablet.
Transfer the GPS data to a useable digital file for updates to the Forest Road Management System (LRMOps). Training will be provided.
Potentially complete data entry into other government data bases, depending on the information captured.
Use of collected data to aid in the creation of FSR summaries to use in determining their eligibility under the Engineering Funding Policy.
If projects become available, aid in minor contract monitoring (overseeing equipment) in the field and reporting back to the contract manager. Training will be provided.

Competencies

Teamwork and Cooperation
Decisive Insight
Planning, Organizing and Coordinating
job_requirements:
Job Requirements

Co-op Level 1 - registered in a recognized co-op program at the undergraduate level.
Course work in natural resources management ie: forestry (preference given to engineering related management)
Excellent English written and oral communication skills.
Strong analytical skills.
Strong computer skills, related to word processing and spreadsheet application, preferably in a Microsoft Windows environment.
Internet research skills.
Ability to work in the field and withstand rigors of field work, may be required to work alone at times.
Must have a valid BC Drivers Licence

Preferred requirements

• Experience in road or forestry surveys
• Experience driving on forestry service roads in all weather conditions
Familiar with mapping software use and associated applications.

job_description:
We're looking for a Data Engineer Co-op (FC Live) to join our paid world-class internship experience. The start date for this position is May 2025 (8-month term), you may be eligible for course credit depending on your institution. The Data Engineer Co-op will report to the Data Science Manager. We are considering onsite and hybrid working options.

Responsibilities:

Work with raw data, design schemas, improve data transformation, and manage deployments and maintenance of data pipelines.

Develop business intelligence and reporting solutions.

Develop real-time ingestion, processing, and alerting data pipelines.

Evaluate feasibility and effectiveness of proposed data solutions.

End-to-end administration and maintain tools, systems, pipelines and ETLs.

Communicate designs, issues, and trade-offs to team members.
job_requirements:
Qualifications:

Hands-on experience with SQL and no-SQL databases.

Experience with Big Data technologies such as Trino, Spark, Databricks, or Kafka.

Experience with data pipeline and workflow management tools such as Airflow.

Experience using business intelligence reporting tools such as Tableau or Looker.

Can think and solve complex data engineering problems in maintainable and scalable fashion.

Experience with several programming languages such as Python, C#, Scala.

Familiarity with machine learning, and statistical approaches to data analysis.

job_title_: S25 Junior Research Assistant - Product Development 164191
job_description:
Key Responsibilities:

As a Product Development Co-op student at CarboNet, you will work with the research and development team to aid in development of new Nanonet formulations for remediation of contaminated water. You will contribute through workflow development and support other members of the team to generate high-throughput treatment data. To do this, you will …

• Execute experiments to fulfill project needs in a dynamic environment

• Perform standard jar testing protocols for design of water treatment packages

• Support pilot scale water treatment processes

• Assist in operating, calibrating, and maintaining laboratory instruments

• Prepare solutions and buffers

• Present research findings to R&D team

• Help prepare and maintain technical documents

• Maintain a safe and fun lab environment
job_requirements:
Requirements:

• Chemistry Knowledge - you are enrolled in an undergraduate degree in Materials Chemistry/ Chemical Engineering or related field and have a genuine interest for problem solving. Experience in a laboratory environment will be beneficial to your success

• Collaborative Communication - you have strong organizational, interpersonal, and analytical skills

• Positive Attitude - you are committed to contributing and supporting a team of like-minded people who are driven. You are an ambitious and enthusiastic person who is able to multitask, work with minimal supervision, and help implement creative solutions

job_description:
Job Title: Equipment & Facility Maintenance - Co-Op

Job ID: R-01262822

Summary:

Participates in departmental projects by drafting project plans and reports; assists in departmental Continuous Improvement (CI) initiatives by compiling data, interviewing key personnel, observing operations, and identifying potential improvements and solutions. Assists Maintenance Management with maintaining metrics and tracking key performance indicators (KPIs); Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) review and revision.

Essential Functions:

Develops and monitors KPIs and metrics on a weekly basis to measure the success of production operations.
Generates reports, dashboards, and visualizations to communicate data findings optimally to collaborators.
Generates weekly OEE (operational equipment effectiveness) and Maximo (CMMS Computerized Maintenance Management System) reports for production operations and lead Continuous Huddles with teams to review data and highlight barriers and counter measures.
Facilitates monthly meetings for Maintenance Leadership team to review OEE (operations equipment effectiveness) and communicate data insights to leadership teams to support decision-making.
Identifies areas in need of improvement and recommend data-driven strategies to enhance departmental operational processes.
Finds opportunities for technology adoption and automation to streamline processes.
Participates in Team Kaizens to help capture data and provides feedback on department processes that affect the building and operations.?
Implements and improves departmental 5S processes.
Provides support to departmental teams and workers, addressing their needs and concerns.
Maintains a safe working environment and reports potential hazards.
Conducts monthly 1:1's with manager for personal development.
job_requirements:
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

Education:

High school diploma/General Educational Development (GED) Certificate is required.
Working towards College diploma or University Degree in related field

Experience:

Requires no previous experience.

Equivalency:

Equivalent combinations of education, training, and relevant work experience may be considered.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

Good written and oral communication skills. Strong accuracy and attention to detail. Ability to multi-task, meeting tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment. Knowledge of GMP and ability to follow SOPs an asset. Proficiency with Microsoft Office software applications. Proficiency with the English language.

Standards and Expectations:

Follow all Environmental Health & Safety Policies and Procedures. Work collaboratively with fellow team members, modelling positive team principles and partnering to meet project and departmental objectives.

Carry out all duties within strict compliance to Patheon quality systems SOP's and Good Manufacturing Practice (GMP). Maintain workspace in a clean and orderly fashion.? Actively engage in and adhere to departmental systems to maintain a smooth and efficient workflow (visual management, scheduling systems,?etc.). Be client and patient conscious?at all times. Understand Key Performance Indicators and strive to improve the performance of the team by identifying areas for system improvements and engage in problem solving. Models positive thinking and is open to change, motivating the team to adapt to shifts in priorities and new ways of working. Proactively identify areas for improvement in the execution of procedures. Communicate risks to timelines in a proactive manner.? Consistently strives to improve skills and knowledge in related field.

Physical Requirements:

Position requires ordinary ambulatory skills and physical coordination sufficient to move about manufacturing/office locations; ability to stand, walk, stoop, kneel, crouch periodically for prolonged periods of time; manipulation (lift, carry, move) of light to medium weights of up to 40 pounds; arm, hand and finger dexterity; visual acuity to operate equipment, and read materials for prolonged periods of time; ability to sit, reach with hands and arms, talk, and hear for prolonged periods of time. Usually in a comfortable environment but with regular exposure to factors causing moderate physical discomfort from such things as dust, loud noise, bright lights, fumes, or odour.?Use of Personal Protective equipment is required and may include any of the following: safety glasses, safety shoes, lab coat, gloves, hair net, beard cover, safety apron, respirator.

job_description:
Job Title: Compliance Training - Co-Op

Job ID: R-01265681

Summary:

Manage GMP document workflows through the respective document lifecycles at site. Perform as Site Administrator of the Electronic Document Management System (eDMS) and the Learning Management System (LMS) to ensure compliance to all applicable standards. Support the archive, retention, and destruction of GMP documents. Support completion of the Corporate Quality Standards alignment process at the site. Support client and regulatory audits as required.

Essential Functions:

Support the migration of job descriptions into the LMS.
Support movement of on the job (OJT) training into the LMS for Processing, Packaging and the Lab, including building OJT requirements, adding OJT into curriculum and recording completion for legacy employees.
Perform as Site Administrator and subject matter expert for eDMS and LMS.
Manage aspects of the document lifecycle workflows through eDMS: preparation, review, assignment of training, as well as document inactivation with associated training curricula removal as required.
Facilitate document lifecycle workflows through LMS: course creation and assignment of training, curriculum maintenance, training verification, curricula maintenance, and curricula removal as required.
Maintain eDMS and LMS in compliance with all applicable regulations, corporate requirements, and site procedures.
Collaborate cross functionally to support various documentation and training needs to ensure compliance to requirements.
Generate system reports to track, trend and monitor training compliance; prepare and distribute site training metrics for eDMS and LMS.
Support delivery of training as required in support of eDMS and LMS function.
Author eDMS and LMS system and process related SOPs and WIs as required.
Complete the periodic (triennial) review process of GMP SOPs and WIs; and LMS training curricula.
Drive continuous improvement of Document Control and Training through Practical Process Improvement (PPI) concepts.
Assist with regulatory / client audits as required.
Manage the process to ensure site document alignment to Corporate Quality Standards and Guidelines.
Support onsite and off-site archival, retrieval, and destruction of GMP Documents as per retention schedule.
Maintains a safe working environment and reports potential hazards.
Performs alternating or rotating shift work (as required).
job_requirements:
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

Education:

High school diploma/General Educational Development (GED) Certificate is required.
Working towards College Diploma in relevant technical field
Working towards Bachelor of Science (B.Sc.) an asset.

Experience:

Requires no previous related experience.
Previous experience delivering training an asset.

Equivalency:

Equivalent combinations of education, training, and relevant work experience may be considered.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

Demonstrated computer proficiency with Microsoft Office programs. Strong ideas, decision making abilities, trouble shooting and thinking-out-of-the-box skills. Excellent organizational, verbal and written communication skills. Familiarity with GMPs. Works well with limited supervision. Excellent organizational, interpersonal, oral and written communication skills. Experience in Microsoft Word, Excel, Access. Experience with EDMS, SuccessFactors is an asset. Proficiency with the English Language.

Standards and Expectations:

Follow all Environmental Health & Safety Policies and Procedures. Work collaboratively with fellow team members, modelling positive team principles and partnering to meet project and departmental objectives. Carry out all duties within strict compliance to quality SOPs and Good Manufacturing Practice (GMP). Maintain workspace in a clean and orderly fashion.? Actively engage in and adhere to departmental systems in order to maintain a smooth and efficient workflow (visual management, scheduling systems, etc.). Be client and patient conscious at all times. Understand Key Performance Indicators and strive to improve the performance of the team by identifying areas for system improvements and engage in problem solving. Models positive thinking and is open to change, motivating the team to adapt to shifts in priorities and new ways of working. Proactively identify areas for improvement in the execution of procedures. Communicate risks to timelines in a proactive manner.? Consistently strives to improve skills and knowledge in related field.

Physical Requirements:

Light physical effort and fatigue. Walks, sits or stands for limited periods. May require occasional equipment operation including keyboard equipment. Lifts light items for limited duration. Typically located in a comfortable indoor area. There may be exposure to mild physical discomfort from factors such as dust, fumes or odours, temperature extremes, loud noise, strong drafts, or bright lights. Use of Personal Protective equipment may be required and may include any of the following: safety glasses, safety shoes, lab coat, gloves, hair net, beard cover, safety apron, respirator on occasionally.

Job Title: Scientist I - Analytical Operations - Co-Op

Job ID: R-01277723

Summary:

Provide analytical support in the Laboratory Operations Department by following standard practices. Perform analytical testing as assigned for on prototype, CTM (Clinical Trial Material) and Commercial batches supporting development and/or manufacturing operations. Make detailed observations and reviews, documents, and communicates test results.

Essential Functions:

Document all experimental data in accordance with Attributable, Legible, Contemporaneous, Original and Accurate (ALCOA).
Carry out independently HPLC, dissolution and physical testing analysis testing following established procedures Analytical Methods & Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs).
Work Proficiency with Empower, NuGenesis, MS Word & Excel Software.
Perform basic troubleshooting to overcome system suitability failures.
Recognize and report unexpected or Out Of Specification (OOS) results immediately to the Supervisor and conducts laboratory investigations under direction.
Maintain a safe working environment and report potential hazards.
May be essential to perform alternating or rotating shift work (as required)

Working towards B.Sc. in chemistry

HOW YOU WILL CONTRIBUTE AND WHAT YOU WILL LEARN

As a part of our team, you will:

Becoming familiar with our test infrastructure that has resulted in many successful routing products in the market.
Develop and maintain infrastructure tools to support our R&D community.
Investigate and resolve issues related to lab and test infrastructure.
Work with industry-standard DevOps tools like Git, Nagios, Puppet, and Ansible.
Gain hands-on experience in various programming languages including Python, Perl, and shell scripts.
Communicate with software developers and testers effectively, understand their requirements, and ultimately provide the best solution in a timely manner.

About Us

Come create the technology that helps the world act together

Nokia is committed to innovation and technology leadership across mobile, fixed and cloud networks. Your career here will have a positive impact on people's lives and will help us build the capabilities needed for a more productive, sustainable, and inclusive world.

We challenge ourselves to create an inclusive way of working where we are open to new ideas, empowered to take risks and fearless to bring our authentic selves to work

What we offer

Nokia offers continuous learning opportunities, well-being programs to support you mentally and physically, opportunities to join and get supported by employee resource groups, mentoring programs and highly diverse teams with an inclusive culture where people thrive and are empowered.

Nokia is committed to inclusion and is an equal opportunity employer

Nokia has received the following recognitions for its commitment to inclusion & equality:

One of the World's Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere
Gender-Equality Index by Bloomberg
Workplace Pride Global Benchmark

At Nokia, we act inclusively and respect the uniqueness of people. Nokia's employment decisions are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. We are committed to a culture of inclusion built upon our core value of respect.

Join us and be part of a company where you will feel included and empowered to succeed.

Experience with databases (MongoDB and SQL)

Desire to go deep in details and get to the bottom of things

job_description:
HOW YOU WILL CONTRIBUTE AND WHAT YOU WILL LEARN

As a student in the hardware group, you will work with a highly experienced embedded software development team specializing in hardware drivers and diagnostics. This software is used to bring up cutting-edge hardware and to create circuit tests. You will gain practical experience by developing real-time embedded software and working in the lab alongside hardware developers. In addition to a technical lead, you will be assigned a 1-to-1 mentor. This mentor is a resource for you to ask any questions, share concerns, learn about Nokia/team culture and career path, or simply have a chat about how you are getting along. This is an onsite position and requires you to be in the office.

As a part of our team, you will:

Develop device driver software for cutting-edge router technology
Create the code that stresses and screens new hardware designs
Work with factory teams to implement a production test program
Develop custom automation scripts to control test equipment

The team you will be a part of

The IP Routing division leads the industry with the best Network Processor technology (FP5), QoS, parallel processing, Network Function Virtualization, and product quality. Products cover the spectrum from small CPE devices supporting a few low-speed Ethernet links to carrier-class and datacenter-class systems supporting terabits of routing capacity. Our world-leading technology enables us to offer customers 800GE and 1.6T links with unparalleled routing features.

job_title_: S25 Invasive Species Ecology - Agroecosystem Sustainability and Rangeland Conservation 164165
job_description:
On behalf of the Government of Canada, Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada (AAFC) provides leadership in the growth and development of a competitive, innovative and sustainable Canadian agricultural sector. The Summerland Research and Development Centre was established in 1914, in the heart of the Okanagan Valley in British Columbia, a semi-arid eco-zone that is Canada's most water challenged and yet most biologically diverse eco-region. This unique setting inspires researchers at the Centre to focus on sustainable crop production practices to help preserve and enhance the resilience of such sensitive environments within and across Canada.

In this context, the Summerland Research and Development Centre (SuRDC) invites applications for co-op students to contribute to the enhancement of agricultural sustainability and rangeland conservation through research on the biological control of invasive plants and insects. We currently have opportunities for two co-op students to develop their practical ecology and evolution skills in field, dry-lab, and wet-lab settings.

The biological control laboratory works to understand the ecology, evolution, and natural history of invasive species, as well as the endemic species with which invaders or their control agents interact. We draw on methods from, plant, molecular and evolutionary ecology, entomology, and conservation biology to develop sustainable, biologically-based methods of invasive species control. Our team consists of several students (undergraduate and graduate), post-doctoral researchers, technicians and research scientists.

The focus of the successful candidate will be to conduct field and lab-based research on the ecological and evolutionary determinants of invasive species success and control. The candidate will develop expertise in plant and insect field ecology and evolution, molecular ecology, and data management and analysis. Together, this work will directly contribute new knowledge of biological control agents of invasive weeds and insects, enhancing agricultural sustainability and rangeland conservation by actively contributing to AAFC's capacity in research on invasive species control. There is the opportunity to develop an independent project related to the biocontrol lab's objectives.
job_requirements:
Statement of Duties/Techniques.

Assist in field and lab trials investigating the biology and ecology of invasive agricultural pests
Field-based collection of insect and plant specimens and data
Identification of plant and insect specimens using dissecting scopes and taxonomic keys
Assessment of plant ecological and morphological traits
Assessment of insect biology, life history and behavioural traits
Culture of greenhouse plants and maintenance insect colonies
Assist in laboratory bioassays to evaluate insect host range
Data entry and manipulation
Other duties as required, which may include: assistance with DNA extractions/amplifications, GIS applications

Desired qualifications: We seek organised, enthusiastic, and self motivated candidates with a desire for new experiences, who are keen to work independently or as a collaborative member of our larger team. Previous experience working with plants / soils / insects, and knowledge of ecology / entomology / botany are helpful, but not required. Possession of a class 5 driver's license is an asset.

job_description:
Job Summary

Sarcomere Dynamics is looking for an Electrical Engineer Coop that is eager to learn, innovative and capable of tackling new challenging material. You will be involved in the design, development, and testing of various embedded systems. Designing robotic systems causes multiple disciplines to overlap so understanding of mechanical design and system integration will be advantageous. This work will help accelerate the development of the hardware for our new robotic systems.

Responsibilities and Tasks

PCB development, documentation, and testing of new hardware based on initial requirements
Version control of schematics and boards developed in KiCAD with GitHub
Evaluate and test electrical designs
Write, test and debug functional software in C/C++ for a variety of embedded robotic systems
Solve various hardware/firmware related issues and collaborate within the design team

About Sarcomere Dynamics Inc

Sarcomere Dynamics is a start-up robotics company that aims to enable robots to adaptively interact with dynamic environments. We are focused on developing next generation robotic hands and grippers based on our proprietary shape memory actuator technology to make this possible. Our actuator technology allows us to push the performance of these devices beyond what is currently possible with conventional actuator technology. Our goal is to see these devices used in a variety of applications and markets such as humanoid robotics, industrial grippers, tele-robotics, and automated farming applications.
job_requirements:

Pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Mechatronics Engineering, Integrated Engineering, Engineering Physics or similar
Understanding of CAD design (experience using Altium/KiCad)
Experience programming microcontrollers in C/C++ (experience with Python is a plus)
Familiar with embedded microcontroller architectures is an advantage
Understanding of communication protocols (like I2C/SPI/CAN/Ethernet/EtherCAT)
Experience using oscilloscopes, logic analyzers and JTAG debuggers
Understanding of electrical circuits and schematics (experience with designing and testing electrical circuits for power and logic-based applications is an asset)

job_description:
Location: Whiterock, BC | Calgary, AB
Internship overview

As an Energy Trading Analyst Intern at GBE Energy, you will be immersed in the fast-paced, high-stakes world of energy trading. This internship is not for the faint of heart. The energy market is unforgiving, and success here demands sharp instincts, hard work, and a relentless drive to compete. You will face tough challenges, early mornings, and long hours, but the work is deeply satisfying, offering the chance to compete against some of the sharpest minds in finance. For those that survive and thrive, rewards are lucrative.
This is an in-office opportunity, where participation on the trade floor is essential. The pulse of the market is a necessary ingredient in the creation of insights and understanding energy fundamentals in real time.

In return, you'll gain irreplaceable market experience, develop a unique skill set, and have the potential to pave the way for future employment in the energy trading sector.

Key responsibilities

Conduct daily energy trading analysis, focusing on the supply and demand factors that drive volatility and uncertainty in the energy grid.

Analyze and monitor energy prices and market trends to provide real-time market insights.

Support the trading team by identifying opportunities based on market conditions, and assisting in the development of trading strategies.

Develop your own trading strategies leveraging GBE's suite of proprietary tools and datasets, gaining hands-on experience in leveraging data-driven insights.

Prepare detailed reports, charts, and presentations for team members and senior management.

Actively contribute to daily trading discussions and decision-making processes.
job_requirements:
Qualifications

Current student or recent graduate pursuing a degree in Economics, Engineering, Data Science, Mathematics, Finance, or a related field.

Strong analytical mindset, with an ability to think quickly and adapt in a fast-paced environment.

Street smarts and resilience, with the capacity to handle high-pressure situations.

Experience in competitive sport, poker, equities trading, crypto trading, or sports betting is considered an asset.

Exceptional work ethic, drive, and a desire to succeed in a demanding field.

Proficiency in Excel, Python, SQL, and data analysis tools, with an interest in energy markets.

What's in It for you
As an intern at GBE Energy, you will gain far more than just experience - you'll have the unique opportunity to be mentored by some of the market's most seasoned veterans. You will be exposed to the very methodology and approach that has enabled our team to adapt and thrive through some of the most significant transitions in the energy market.

GBE Energy has successfully navigated shifts such as the transition from coal to gas-fired electricity, weather volatility, the rise and market penetration of wind, solar, and battery technologies, and the ever-evolving demand patterns driven by factors like data centers and electric vehicles.

This internship offers:

Direct Learning from Experts: You will learn firsthand how our traders have continually adapted their strategies to respond to these market shifts, maintaining a competitive edge in an unforgiving environment.

Real Market Exposure: You will witness how seasoned professionals analyze, strategize, and execute trades in real time, providing you with practical insights into the fast-paced world of energy trading.

Growth and Development: You will sharpen your analytical skills, develop market instincts, and gain practical knowledge that will prepare you for success in this high-stakes industry.

Career Path Opportunities: For those who excel, this internship offers the potential for future employment within GBE Energy, as well as irreplaceable experience that will distinguish you in the energy sector.

Qualifications

Preferred candidates will be enrolled in an Environmental Studies or related technical program, and have demonstrated interest, involvement or experience in environmental initiatives.
Sound working knowledge and experience with Microsoft Office is required.
A valid Class 5 or Class 7 BC drivers' license, and First Aid with CPR certificate are required.
The successful candidate possesses effective interpersonal skills including working well with customers and the general public and the ability and willingness to:
Complete waste (garbage) audits for contamination (training will be provided).
Communicate effectively both verbally and writing.
Multi-task and work independently with minimal supervision.
Utilize Microsoft Office proficiently.
Preference will be given to candidates aged 15-30 years as per the Canada Summer Jobs Program through Service Canada, however candidates outside of this age range will be considered.

job_description:
Introduction

The IBM Canada Lab in Markham, Ontario is one of the largest R&D facilities in Canada. As a Design intern at the IBM Canada Lab, you would be part of a team that transforms our customer's challenges into solutions.
The mission of IBM's global software design organization is to empower users to do their best work through intuitive and visually engaging interfaces. As a Designer, you'll play a crucial role in creating end-to-end customer experiences.

Your Role and Responsibilities

This position resides in Markham, ON and is a 16 month work term commencing in May 2025. It is mandatory that all applicants are enrolled in full-time studies at a post-secondary institution and returning to full-time studies upon completion of the work-term.

As an IBM Z Designer, your focus will be on meeting individual and team objectives, learning your craft, contributing to the design of a product and learning about IBM and IBM Design practices.

Generally, your efforts may be concentrated around one or more products in your business area, with guidance and feedback from a more senior designer or design leader. You will also contribute to the design community by supporting community activities, sharing, learning or maintaining a part of the community operation.
As designers, we focus on ensuring the experiences we create meet the needs of our customers and end users and strive for design excellence in our work.

You will apply a user-centered perspective to your design work and advocate for the customer / end user in all interactions with your teammates and colleagues. At times you may also engage with customers or other users of the product in the design process.

Key/Strategic Responsibilities

Grow domain knowledge by learning the value proposition of your product, its market position, the basics of its technologies and how it's used by our customers.
Develop enough domain fluency to contribute ideas that differentiate the solution in the market.
Attend and participate in design and product-oriented activities, such as stand-ups, Town Halls, product demos or design critiques.
Develop the ability to find and apply relevant industry references/trends.
Identify improvement opportunities at the individual product level

Cross-Functional Responsibilities

Attend client / sponsor user sessions; establish your own client relationships.
Contribute to the design of a product by advocating for the user experience and value.
Learn about the org structure and key stakeholders of your PM and dev teams
Seek and provide feedback on outcomes to your entire team.
Support advocacy of design thinking across the team.
Communicate with other designers and your 3iab team about your project status.
Attend and participate in design reviews and playbacks to share experience design and related artifacts.
Understand how your work fits into the department mission, strategy, and vision.

Functional Responsibilities

Contribute towards delivery of project needs, such as research insights or user experience deliverables, in alignment with timeline and roadmap milestones.
Participate in concept ideation informed by an understanding of users, clients, and their desired outcomes.
Adapt work and processes according to guidance and direction from design leads.
Strengthen your craft skills in your discipline through learning, mentorship, and producing.
Expand competencies across t-shape to better contribute to personal and team outcomes.
Acquire Enterprise Design Thinking fluency and infuse practices into work.
Develop foundational knowledge in the technologies needed for your product/org, such as AI.
Develop entry-level knowledge of IBM Experience Standards.
Participate in internal and external design community activities.
Familiarity with accessibility guidelines and principles (e.g., WCAG)

UI Problem Solving: Ability to solve complex user problems through user interface design, creating mock-ups, prototypes, and documenting interaction patterns.

Visual Design Skills: Proficient in creating visually compelling artifacts, icons, high fidelity mock-ups, and other graphical elements for user interfaces.
Design Principles: Knowledge of design principles including typography, layout, imagery, colour theory, and creating efficiencies in visual design workflows.
Communication Skills: Proven communication skills and the ability to understand and address customer requirements effectively.

Attention to Detail: Appreciation for detail, ensuring every pixel and interaction is meticulously crafted.

Registered in a formal co-op/internship program

job_description:
Job Title: Emergency Response, Engineering or Sciences Co-op

Full job description

Join a global professional services leader. We are committed to solving the world's biggest challenges in the areas of water, energy and urbanization.

Committed to sustainable development, GHD improves the physical, natural and social environments of the many communities in which we operate.

We offer a professional and friendly culture based on our core values of Safety, Teamwork, Respect and Integrity. We also provide attractive career and professional development through the GHD Business School.

Come join our dynamic Emergency Preparedness and Response Team in the Western Canadian region to grow your career to the next level! As an Environmental Engineer/Scientist Co-op, you will play a meaningful role within our Environmental Group. This position gives candidate the unique experience of working in a matrix business performing work with skilled professionals across North America in a collaborative environment with opportunities for specialization and advancement. This is a hybrid position based out of our Vancouver, BC office to start May 2025.

Emergency Spill Response:

Required to be available 24/7 to assist with emergency spill response work for clients in various provinces across western Canada
Spills may include train derailments, pipeline releases, trucking accidents, chemical spills, etc.
Emergency Preparedness and Planning, and Incident Management (ICS)
Assist in preparing emergency response plans, participation in emergency exercises, and provision of training to clients, etc.
Work with various business groups within the region in order to accomplish urgent client deliverables and tasks
Experience in environmental investigation and remediation

Field Work:

Participate in emergency spill response projects
Responsible for contractor oversight tasks including containment/confinement of spills, drilling, monitoring well installation, soil excavation, product removal, stream rehabilitation, site restoration, etc.
Conduct water level monitoring, groundwater sampling, surface water sampling, and soil sampling
Drone/UAV operation and surveying
Industrial hygiene air monitoring and sampling

Report Writing:

Assist with preparation of regulatory submissions on behalf of clients
Create progress updates and draft reports to be reviewed by supervisor or project manager
Build charts, tables and figures for review by project manager
Assist in the preparation of project related memorandums and reports
Assist other team members and project managers with proposal writing
Researching regulatory information using various resources

Hourly range: $22.50 - $29.00 per hour, based on experience.

B.Sc. (Bachelor of Science or Bachelor of Engineering (Environmental, Civil, Geological, Chemical or equivalent). Minor in business administration would be an asset

Flexible work schedule, ability to work weekends, holidays and nights when required

Excellent written and verbal communication skills are vital to this role in order to effectively express technical information to multiple audiences including subcontractors, field staff, clients, colleagues, etc.
Work as a team member to exceed client expectations

Bombardier Eco demonstrator. Supporting the Eco demonstrator, you will join the Fly-By-Wire (FBW) team, more specifically the Research & Development group on the T602 project with focus on critical aircraft control architecture aspects and new FBW system. Our team oversees the Flight-By-Wire (FBW) system on the Global 7500 platform and, as well, secondary flight controls (Wing High Lift, Spoiler) on all other Bombardier platform (G7500, G5/6000, Challenger (350/650)). In addition to in-service issue investigations and leading the improvement of these systems, the team is in charge to define and optimize the FBW system on future platform.

You will start working on a virtual environment (Virtual Test Bench) in order to support the integration effort between the different systems model to check multiple interfaces and logic with our partner Thales in preparation to the verification campaign on our integrated test benches:

Aircraft Control System Integration Laboratory (ACSIL).
Flight Control System Integration Laboratory (FCSIL).

job_title_: S25 Software Engineer, AI Platform - Intern 164276B
salary: Salary Not Available, 0 hours per week
job_description:
Who We Are

Nuro exists to better everyday life through robotics. Founded in 2016, Nuro has spent eight years developing autonomous driving (AD) technology and commercializing AD applications. The Nuro Driver™ is our world-class autonomous driving system that combines AD hardware with our generalized AI-first self-driving software. Built to learn and improve through data, the Nuro Driver™ is one of the few driverless autonomous technologies on public roads today.

Nuro has raised over $2B in capital from Fidelity, Bailie Gifford, T. Rowe Price, Google, and other leading investors. We've partnered with some of the world's most respected brands including Uber, FedEx, Domino's, Walmart, Kroger, and 7-Eleven.

About the Role

As a software engineering intern, you will work closely with leading experts in the field of machine learning, robotics, and software. Depending on your skill sets and areas of interest, you will work on some or all of the following: Data Platform, Onboard Systems, ML Infrastructure, Simulation, or Technical Infrastructure teams.

About the Work

Depending on your skill set and areas of interest you will work on some or all of the following:

Data Platform: The Data Platform serves as a comprehensive management system for Nuro AI Driver's data, labels, and metrics, facilitating seamless access functionality. The team focuses on data annotation across various domains, including 2D/3D perception, mapping, behavior trajectory, and language/text. It also handles data ingestion and mining, employing methods such as heuristics and embedding search. Additionally, the platform supports the autonomy evaluation infrastructure by providing detailed introspection.

Onboard Systems: Our onboard system team's software engineers provide a reliable and high-performance platform that allows our autonomy teams to integrate their autonomy software and algorithms that work across various self-driving platforms. This work requires close collaboration with our software teams, hardware teams, and systems/safety team to make sure new software and hardware work together safely and reliably and resolve onboard error and performance problems.

ML Infrastructure: The ML Infra team is the accelerator to our ML-first autonomy strategy. This team provides solutions to empower machine learning development in Nuro and optimize on-cloud training and onboard inference. Our solutions include a distributed training platform, ML compiler, model components libraries, e.t.c. The team provides opportunities for infra engineers to work fully embedded in ML teams to build cutting edge deep learning technologies.

Simulation: The Simulation team builds the simulator that allows us to develop and test our autonomous driving technology in a virtual setting. We work on the core simulator and simulation frameworks, sensor simulation, scenario generation, and solutions that combine real-world data with synthetic techniques to push the boundaries of what can be simulated, collaborating closely with teams across Autonomy and AI Platform to allow us to simulate realistically and reliably at scale.

Technical Infrastructure: this group owns few fundamental services for entire engineering organizations: generic compute platform to host mission-critical workflows such as data processing and simulation, storage management service which manages hundreds of PB of data, cloud infrastructure serves as IaaC which provisions and maintains all cloud resources, engineering productivity provides tools such as build and CI/CD to make engineering work more efficient.

About You

You have deep expertise and prior experience in some or many of the following areas:

You are a current BS or MS candidate in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Robotics, or a related field graduating in December 2025 or later

You have experience in one or more of the following areas: backend API design, applications development, large-scale distributed systems; data storage and processing systems; advanced algorithms using C++ and Python; machine learning, multithreading; x86 architecture; and software performance tuning and optimization, robotics software frameworks, different compute modalities (CPU, GPU, FPGA) etc.

You have strong problem solving and programming skills.

At Nuro, we celebrate differences and are committed to a diverse workplace that fosters inclusion and psychological safety for all employees. Nuro is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and expressly prohibits any form of workplace discrimination based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristics.

job_description:
About Glean

We're on a mission to make knowledge work faster and more humane. We believe that AI will fundamentally transform how people work. In the future, everyone will work in tandem with expert AI assistants who find knowledge, create and synthesize information, and execute work. These assistants will free people up to focus on the higher-level, creative aspects of their work.

We're building a system of intelligence for every company in the world. On the surface, you can think of it as Google + ChatGPT for the enterprise. Under the hood, our platform is the connective tissue between AI and knowledge. It brings all of a company's knowledge together, understands it at a deep level, provides industry-leading search relevance over it, and connects it to generative AI agents and applications.


Glean was founded by a seasoned team of former Google search and Facebook engineers who saw a need in the enterprise space for their technical depth and passion for AI. We're a diverse team of curious and creative people who want to help each other get big things done-so we can help other teams do the same.

We're backed by some of the Valley's leading venture capitalists-including Sequoia, Kleiner Perkins, Lightspeed, and General Catalyst-and have assembled a world-class team with senior leadership experience at Google, Slack, Facebook, Dropbox, Rubrik, Uber, Intercom, Pinterest, Palantir, and others.

Role
As a Software Engineer intern, you will participate in designing, developing, and maintaining software solutions that power our products and services. We are mainly looking for summer interns, but open to a few off-cycle interns throughout the school year. This is a hybrid internship role based out of Palo Alto, CA.
What we're looking for
A team player, a strong desire to learn, and an owner mentality
Comfortable working in a fast paced, data-driven environment
Interested in something in the realm of Backend, Infrastructure, Security, UI/full-stack, or ML/NLP/Search
Prior internship experience in one or more of the areas above
Strong foundation in CS and software development fundamentals
Will graduate from B.S., M.S. or Ph.D. in Computer Science or equivalent program the following year

Benefits

Company events
Healthy lunches and dinners provided daily
We are a diverse bunch of people and we want to continue to attract and retain a diverse range of people into our organization. We're committed to an inclusive and diverse company. We do not discriminate based on gender, ethnicity, sexual orientation, religion, civil or family status, age, disability, or race.

job_title_: S25 Software Developer Intern, Precision Health Platform 164273B
job_description:
Who We Are

Verily is a subsidiary of Alphabet that is using a data-driven approach to change the way people manage their health and the way healthcare is delivered. Launched from Google X in 2015, our purpose is to bring the promise of precision health to everyone, every day. We are focused on generating and activating data from a variety of sources, including clinical, social, behavioral and the real world, to arrive at the best solutions for a person based on a comprehensive view of the evidence. Our unique expertise and capabilities in technology, data science and healthcare enable the entire healthcare ecosystem to drive better health outcomes.

Verily's internship is a paid 13 week program for rising seniors, either undergraduate or graduate students, who are interested in working at the intersection of technology, data science and healthcare. The program is designed for Computer Science students, and again this year we encourage students who have been historically underrepresented in this field to explore the program, which is a pathway towards full-time employment within Verily. This includes but is not limited to: women, Black/African-American, Latine/Hispanic, Native American, people with disabilities, veterans, and members of the LGBTQ+ community.

**Join us for a unique 13 week internship that will take place May to August 2025

Description

Verily Canada operates from Google offices in Kitchener-Waterloo and Toronto, and is home to many full-stack software projects. As a member of the Precision Health Platform engineering organization, you will build modular, composable, and interoperable components, supporting both platform modules and user facing applications. These components affect the storage, processing and display of precision health data, as well as other products across Verily.

Responsibilities
Work closely with the development team to design, develop, and deliver new software features across the Verily tech stack.
Come up with ideas to technical design problems, compare options, and propose solutions.
Develop using industry-standard tools including GitHub, Google Cloud, Golang, React, Docker, and Terraform to name a few.

Why Join Us

Build What's Vital.

At Verily, you are a part of something bigger. We are a diverse team of builders innovating at the intersection of health and technology-united by a shared spirit of curiosity, resilience and determination to make better health possible for all. This builder mindset means your fingerprints will be on the work that shapes the future of health.

Fulfilling our precision health purpose starts with the health of our Veeps, which is why we offer flexibility, resources, and competitive benefits to support you in your whole-person well being.

Our culture reflects the behaviors that stem from living our values every day in how we Innovate Healthcare and Technology, Gain Velocity as One Verily, and Respect Individuals. As One Verily, we uphold our collective accountability to sustain this culture and to create a VIBE (Verily's Culture of Inclusion, Belonging, and Equitability) where all Veeps feel included, a sense of belonging, and have opportunities to grow.

If this sounds exciting to you, we would love to hear from you.

You can find out more about our company culture on our LinkedIn Company Page and Verily Careers page.
job_requirements:
Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications

Currently enrolled in university working towards an Undergrad or Graduate degree in Computer Science or related field.
Authorization to work in Canada.

Preferred Qualifications

Previous internship or demonstrated experience (i.e. personal projects, volunteer projects, etc) in software development.
Experience with one or more general purpose programming languages including but not limited to: Java, C/C++, C#, Objective-C, Go, Python, or JavaScript.
Experience with cloud computing platforms such as GCP or AWS.
Ability to work independently and collaborate effectively.
Academic or professional exposure to healthcare or life sciences, with emphasis on HL7 FHIR.

The CAD base pay range for this intern position is CAD 40.63-50.48. Our pay ranges are determined by role, education level, experience, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire pay ranges for the position across all Canadian locations. Your recruiter can share more about the specific pay range for your preferred location during the hiring process.

Data collection
Participant Recruitment

Collecting radiographic information

Chart reviews

Survey administration/scoring questionnaires

Literature searches
General research administrative duties

job_description:
POSITION OVERVIEW

dormakaba is seeking a Firmware Engineering Intern to join our Summer 2025 Rising Talent Program in Montreal, Quebec!

About dormakaba

We are a global provider of access and security solutions, specializing in the management of doors and access points. dormakaba offers a wide range of products and services, including electronic access control systems, mechanical locks, and key management solutions.

dormakaba Rising Talent Internship Program

Are you looking for opportunities to tackle real-world business challenges alongside global leaders while putting your knowledge and skills into practice? Then dormakaba's Rising Talent Internship Program is the program for you!

Whether interns are tasked with working in the plant programming robotic equipment on our Manufacturing shop floor or drafting designs of new products, or connecting with customers, out interns are given projects that drive our business!

What Interns Will Unlock at dormakaba

Interns will walk away with a professional headshot, a larger professional network, and a one-of-a-kind experience in the security and access solutions industry at a leading global company. The summer consists of weekly business Lunch and Learn sessions, community volunteer activities, and team building events with peers and senior leadership!

Applicants must be authorized to work for any employer in Canada. We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of an employment visa at this time.

WHAT YOU WILL DO

Implementing security enhancements to protect against vulnerabilities and improve data integrity
Identify, analyze, and resolve firmware bugs impacting product performance.
Address and fulfill specific firmware requests originating from production needs, ensuring that the firmware meets manufacturing requirements and supports efficient production workflows.
Gather data and analyze the business challenges alongside subject matter experts.
Drive evidence-based decision-making that helps design a new process.
Schedule routine check-in meetings with your supervisor to monitor the advancement of assigned projects.
Attend weekly lunch and learn sessions where you will get to learn more about a business topic of the week! Some examples of past topics include: Top 10 Presentation Skills, Environmental Health and Safety, StrengthsFinder, etc.
Deep dive into data and use evidence-based decision making that helps design a new process, introduce new technology, re-imagines the way we collaborate, or positively influences our culture.
Sit in on meetings both within and beyond your designated role to broaden your engagement.
Collaborate with other interns on projects.

WHAT WE REQUIRE

Pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Electronic or Electrical Engineering with an anticipated graduation date in December 2026 through Spring 2028
Ability to work full-time, 37.5 hours peer week for 10-12 weeks (May-August 2025)

WHY JOIN DORMAKABA?

We are at the heart of?every place that matters. As a leading global provider in the access solutions market for schools, banks, airports, hospitals, and hotels, we enable seamless movement within secure, safe, and sustainable places. Our work is IMPORTANT. YOU are important. ?We provide our people with the tools to shape their careers for growth. With around 16,000 employees worldwide, EVERY team member contributes to our mission and can make a positive difference. By working as one global team, we continue Growing the Business, Growing Together, and Growing Ourselves. Build your career with us!

Learn why our employees enjoy working for dormakaba: dormakaba Testimonials

job_title_: S25 Co-op or Intern RPA Developer (May to August 2025) 164249B
job_description:
Putting people first, every day


BDO is a firm built on a foundation of positive relationships with our people and our clients. Each day, our professionals provide exceptional service, helping clients with advice and insight they can trust. In turn, we offer an award-winning environment that fosters a people-first culture with a high priority on your personal and professional growth.

Your Opportunity

BDO Canada is looking for a Co-op/Intern RPA Developer?to become a part of our Canadian team. For the summer term May to August 2025. As a key contributor, you will be part of delivery teams building robotic process automation solutions for clients across multiple challenging domains. The ideal candidate is comfortable showing technical leadership and helping deliver quality with their teams. To be successful, you will:

Deliver project results through high-quality service and repeatable business solutions

Understand, diagnose, and recommend solutions for specific functional and technical challenges

Communicate with clients to understand their unique business challenges and find ways to streamline their processes through automating day to day tasks using RPA and Power Automate.

Design, code, and test automation workflows using UiPath

Contribute to the development of new ideas and approaches, to improve work processes

Make changes as required, maintain and support RPA bots after development for stability and future growth.

How do we define success for your role?

You demonstrate BDO's core values through all aspect of your work: Integrity, Respect & Collaboration

You understand your client's industry, challenges, and opportunities; client describe you as positive, professional, and delivering high-quality work

You identify, recommend, & are focused on effective service delivery to your clients

You share in an inclusive & engaging work environment that develops, retains & attracts talent

You actively participate in the adoption of digital tools and strategies to drive an innovative workplace

You grow your expertise through learning & professional development

Your experience and education

Experience in building RPA solutions using UiPath technology stack

Experience in C#, Visual Basic

Experience in MS Dynamics is nice to have

Experience in Power Automate is nice to have

Show ability to mentor and teach newer developers

Experience in financial services is an asset


Why BDO?

Our people-first approach to talent has earned us a spot among Canada's Top 100 Employers for 2024. This recognition is a milestone we're thrilled to add to our collection of awards for both experienced and student talent experiences.

Our firm is committed to providing an environment where you can be successful in the following ways:

We enable you to engage with how we change and evolve, being a key contributor to the success and growth of BDO in Canada.

We help you become a better professional within our services, industries, and markets with extensive opportunities for learning and development.

We support your achievement of personal goals outside of the office and making an impact on your community.

Giving back adds up: Where company meets community. BDO is actively involved in our communities by supporting local charity initiatives. We support staff with local and national events where you will be given the opportunity to contribute to your community.


Total rewards that matter: We pay for performance with competitive total cash compensation that recognizes and rewards your contribution. We provide flexible benefits from day one, and a market leading personal time off policy. We are committed to supporting your overall wellness beyond working hours and provide reimbursement for wellness initiatives that fit your lifestyle.


Everyone counts: We believe every employee should have the opportunity to participate and succeed. Through leadership by our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion Leader, we are committed to a workplace culture of respect, inclusion, and diversity. We recognize and celebrate the valuable differences among each of us, including race, religious beliefs, physical or mental disabilities, age, place of origin, marital status, family status, gender or gender identity and sexual orientation. If you require accommodation to complete the application process, please contact us.

Flexibility: All BDO personnel are expected to spend some of their time working in the office, at the client site, and virtually unless accommodations or alternative work arrangements are in place.

Our model is a blended approach designed to support the flexible needs of our people, the firm and our clients. It's about creating work experiences that meet everyone's needs and providing flexibility to adjust when, where and how we work to meet the expectations of our role.

Code of Conduct: Our Code of Conduct sets clear standards for how we conduct business. It reflects our shared values and commitments and includes guiding principles to help us make ethical decisions and maintain trust with each other, our clients, and the public.

Ready to make your mark at BDO? Click "Apply now" to send your up-to-date resume to one of our Talent Acquisition Specialists.

To explore other opportunities at BDO, check out our careers page.

U.S. Citizenship required.

What you'll do:

Infrastructure Core Bidding
In this role, you will drive innovation in our Core Bidding Platform that both supports our business as well as empowers our customers to reach the right audience at the right time for the right price. Our bidding platform supports up to 15M impression opportunities per second that we're evaluating on our customers' behalf.

As a Product Management Intern on this team, you will leverage your technical skills and curiosity as well as business stakeholders to tune and streamline bidding behavior with advanced functionality while keeping auction performance, auction fees along with system and client demands in mind. You will be working with stakeholders across the company in addition to our world class engineering and data science teams to bring our shared vision real time bidding to life.

Measurement
In this role, you will help the Measurement Product team help clients understand the performance of their advertising efforts. This can include identifying ways to improve our Brand Lift Offering by creating benchmarks and helping advertisers create a test and learn agenda to deeply understand how they move consumers through the marketing funnel. You will be working with stakeholders across the company to bring our shared vision for measuring programmatic advertising to life.

job_title_: S25 Actuarial Student Co-op Program - Life & Health 164218B
salary: Salary Not Available, 37.5 hours per week
job_description:
Company Description

PartnerRe is a leading, privately owned, multi-line global reinsurer with a reputation of financial stability and strength, and a commitment to rebuilding businesses and communities after risk events around the world.

Our mission is to continue to be a financially stable and predictable business partner, supporting our clients with solutions tailored to their needs, delivering superior returns to our owner, providing rewarding opportunities for our people and making a positive contribution to society. To achieve this, we live by our values of Integrity, Performance, Collaboration, Straightforward Communication and Respect and Care.

Core to The PartnerRe Experience is our global nature. No matter where you sit in the company, you are part of something bigger. Our teams represent our truly international mindset, forging connections across office locations and all levels of the organization and building a network of mutual success. The result is a day-to-day experience that will allow you to:

Shape your own career

Grow in a supportive environment

Connect with a community of experts

Make an impact

View The PartnerRe Experience e-book to learn more about what it's like to work at PartnerRe.

Job Description

In your application, please indicate if you are interested in a winter (commencing January 2025), summer (commencing May 2025), or fall (commencing September 2025) co-op term.

We are looking to recruit talented students for our Pricing, Valuation, and Project teams. The internships provide an opportunity to obtain valuable hands-on industry experience from experts in the field while participating and contributing to the teams' work and vision. The roles are as follow:

Experience Study

Projects (IFRS17, LDTI, etc.)

Valuation

Pricing

Note that the posted positions are for a 4-month work term, with the flexibility of extending to 8 months. PartnerRe also offers an opportunity for interns to return and gain experience with our various actuarial teams. This rotation opportunity is dependent of the performance of the student in their first term.

Responsibilities:

AXIS Modelling - Design and build projection models for individual life reinsurance transactions.

Data Analysis - Work extensively with large datasets in SQL and R to perform rigorous analysis of client/enforce experience data.

Financial Analysis - Assist in the preparation and analysis of reserves, required capital, and financial statements.

Project Work - Provide support to Valuation and Pricing functions (experience analysis, IFRS17, LTDI, etc.).

We encourage innovations and process improvements from our staff. If you are someone who would like to leave an impact and make a difference, please apply!

Additional Information

Transportation & Housing

The internships will be situated in our Canadian office, which is conveniently located in downtown Toronto near Union Station, accessible by GO Transit and the TTC. Transportation assistance will be provided for students moving from out of province.

Compensation and Benefit Information

We offer competitive compensations and support our students with a comprehensive Actuarial Student Study Program.

PartnerRe provides a working environment in which diversity is valued, where all employees feel welcome, respected, and empowered to perform at their best. We invite you to learn more about D&I at PartnerRe.
job_requirements:
Qualifications

Second/Third/Fourth year student in Actuarial Science.

A minimum of one Society of Actuaries exam.

Understanding of life insurance products. Previous work experience with life insurance would be considered an asset.

Strong technical skills including MS Excel and SQL or similar database management tool. R Programming skills are desirable.

Experience with the GGY AXIS actuarial system is an asset.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

Excellent verbal and written communications skills.

Work independently and as part of a team.

job_description:
JOB DESCRIPTION:

BC Research Inc., (www.bcri.ca) is looking to hire a chemistry student for an 8-month term (with possibility to extend) at our technology commercialization and innovation centre. BC Research is a privately held company specializing in developing innovative chemical processes and products from concept to commercialization. We are located on Mitchell Island in Richmond, BC.

Currently, we are engaged in a variety of projects which include process and product development in fields such as clean-tech, wastewater, pulp and paper and chemical production. These novel processes are being developed in the lab at the bench scale and at an intermediary scale in our pilot plant facility. BCRI is looking for a student with demonstrated academic achievement, hands-on "know how" and the ability to work independently. The student will contribute to lab experiments for bench-scale projects and support pilot plant projects through analytical testing and material characterization.

Projected tasks include:
· Performing lab experiments and bench-scale tests
· Performing analytical tests and sample preparation (HPLC, GC, IC, AAS, TGA, DSC, FTIR)
· Documenting experiments and analytical data
· Performing literature research
· Maintain lab and analytical equipment
job_requirements:
REQUIREMENTS:

BC Research is looking for a self-motivated and detail-oriented undergraduate co-op student in Chemistry. The successful candidate will have previous lab experience and a strong chemistry background, but more importantly demonstrate a desire and ability to learn new fields. The current opportunity will offer exposure to an exciting range of research and projects as the candidate conducts testing and offers support to on-going projects. Previous co-op, research and/or analytical chemistry experience would be beneficial for this position.

OTHER REQUIREMENTS:

Valid Canadian work permit

Excellent written and spoken communication in English
